User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.15) Gecko/20110303 Firefox/3.6.15

My Symantec security system has encountered a misleading application (Virus Doctor) which appears to be using Mozilla as the vehicle. C:\users\malcolm\appdata\local\mozilla\firefox\profiles\ptoqa6ck.default\cache\6281e872d01

Symantec removed the data.

Reproducible: Sometimes

Actual Results:  
Not attempted

Expected Results:  
Not applicable

It's a pity you do not have the ability to attach a picture file then I could send you a screen shot
comments.creator: field27@sky.com

comments.text: We do have such an ability :-) Check out the Add an attachment link above.
comments.raw_text: We do have such an ability :-) Check out the Add an attachment link above.

Can you reproduce the issue described in safe mode or on a clean profile.
If yes, it is likely to be a bug.
Here are some references that might be helpful:
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe%20Mode
http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/profiles
